attributes.action: Review the Benefit System (how it is assessed)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I have worked for 30 years and was laid off last Christmas, which was a huge blow considering I am the breadwinner of the family.  After 6mths of unemployment I was told that I was no longer entitled to JSA Contributory as I'd ran out of contributions based on the previous year!  I was also told that I was not entitled to JSA Income based, as although my husband only earns around £5k a year, he was working full time to achieve that figure!  As a result I was then told that I was no longer eligible for Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit!!  My husband has now reduced his working hours and we are reapplying for Housing and Council Tax Benefit. I think it's ridiculous that benefit is assessed on how many hours you work, rather than your actual income, as some people earn £50 an hr and some (like my husband) may only earn around £4 an hr!  Income Support used to support low incomes when I was in my 20's, but now it only supports NO income!  Maybe it should be called No Income Support!  It's a shambles and everyone I speak to feel that it is disgusting the way we're being treated.
